comments.commentBody:
Thank you, New York Times for doing this excellent investigative journalism to find the truth of the 2016 stolen presidency and corruption.
The United States of America is becoming the Banana Republic; we need The New York Times and The Washington Post to work together
on this investigation until the end.

replies.commentBody: For all anyone knows, this may have arisen more out of some old grudge he bore against Hillary.  Protecting Trump only hurt her more.

comments.commentBody:
This goes beyond politics. As much as I respect Obama, he was damned by his own decency and should have launched a full-blown investigation of Trump & his people while he was still president and let the chips fall where they may.

It is obvious to all but the blindest partisans that there was EXTENSIVE contact between the Trump campaign and Russian officials. The dossier on Trump barely scratched the surface and the Dworkin Report, NYTimes, WaPo, New Yorker, & even Teen Vogue have provided additional chilling details about our so-called president who is an out and out puppet of Putin and Russia.

In a way it is good that the GOP continues to obstruct, deny, and act in concert with Trump and their Russian masters and hopefully this will destroy the lives and political careers of ANYONE with an R after their name. To that end Trump may well get his wish and MAGA-- just not in a way he envisioned.
Thanks a lot, Obama. Seriously, thank you.

replies.commentBody: How did they miss it after having 298 hearings on Benghazi?

comments.commentBody: I find it interesting Obama and company wanted to preserve all Trumps communications, but did not preserve and of Hillary's communications with Libya, Syria, Mexico,  The DNC, or any of her aides that she had destroy evidence in a investigation.  I wonder why oh yeah Barry was covering his backside.
Let's all send gallons of nasty, cheap alcohol to Bannon.  What could go wrong???
Obama always shows up to a knife fight with a book. He did not stop Russia's interfering with the election for fear of being seen as interfering himself.

I have never gotten over Trump's false moral equivalency between America and Russia !  Everywhere I look there are people in Trump's administration connected in some underhanded way to Russia. Wilber Ross, who Trump has appointed as head of the Commerce Department, owns a bank in Cyprus that is a known for Russian money laundering for corrupt Russian oligarchs. Interestingly, Trump owed $40 million in loans that were being called in and Wilber Ross's Russian bank gave him $60 million. Sooo, Wilber is now head of the United State's Commerce Department, everything Russian !  Tonight, we learn the appointed Attorney General, Jeff Sessions, lied about his communication with a Russian ambassador in September. Russia's involvement was everywhere in the paper ....there was no reason for him to lie before congress, unless he's covering up something  !   Manafort, Carter Page, Flynn, and Tillerson all up to their eyeballs working for Russia's interest and theirs, not America's ! Trump, not long ago, said he thought NATO wasn't useful anymore, but last night,  he said we stand with NATO. I think,  he changed his tune because of the push back by our generals, otherwise, he would have continued with Putin's desire to dismantle NATO. I think Trump is our first elected Russian president and investigations need to proceed now !
Thank you, President Obama's patriotic team. Thank you NYT.

Woodward and Bernstein go to work.  Is there a Sam Ervin and a Howard Baker in the Senate?  Is Jeff Sessions the new John Mitchell? Can any reasonable, open minded person doubt that a special prosecutor should be appointed to investigate this mess and that a select committee should be established in the Senate for the same purpose? No matter of what political persuasion or ideological bent it must be obvious to all that the integrity of our election process and our national security requires it!

replies.commentBody: Trump doesn't have to point out the lying media because you have done it for him. Thank you for that.

comments.commentBody:
And now here will come a flood of strident accusations from Trump saying: "See? Didn't I tell you? They're making all this stuff up!!!!!. I've told you over and over again not to trust the lying dishonest media!!

Or in an older quip: 'Who are you going to believe? Me or your lying eyes?
This reminds me of Joe McCarthy. Anonymous sources  and anonymous documents.6

replies.commentBody: I don't think Pence can be president if the Trump machine orchestrated the election scam in cahoots with Russia. In fact, many of the congressional elections (Representatives and Senators) were also skewed by Russian interference and propaganda.

comments.commentBody: Traitorous. Pence will be president the only mystery is who will be VP??

This may very well be the most elaborate smear campaign in recorded history. We know the IRS was used to spy on Republican PAC's. It now appears that even our intelligence agencies were part of the Clinton/Obama political machine. I'm an independent voter, but this is borderline absurd. So the Russians are now SO INTELLIGENT AND SOPHISTICATED,  they can help Trump beat 16 other Republicans in primary after primary, they can mobilize millions to attend Trump's rallies, they can help Trump win nationally televised debates when his opponent had been leaked questions,  they can hack the DNC but not the GOP, or Libertarian party, or Green Party.  This is the Salem Witch Trials of the Information age. Dossiers, photos, videos, audio can be conjured up to say or prove anything anywhere.  Unbelievable.
When did it become illegal for American citizens to communicate with foreign citizens?

replies.commentBody: You'd better start learning to say "Yes Master" in Russian.

So true. Obama knew of the Russian hacks as early as June because "private" DNC emails were released that showed collusion against Bernie Sanders, but it was not an issue at that time because Hillary beat Bernie and was expected to beat Trump by "a landslide" up to election night. Russia only became an issue after Hillary lost the election and Obama and perhaps the Clintons scrambled to undermine Trumps win and explain away their abject failure.
The truth is this type of "interference" will happen in every election and there's no way to stop it; the free flow of information and the stealing of less secured emails is not something you can ever stop in this digital age of the internet.
The good news is that Russia did not enter the polling booths and did not pull any levers- at most they just added to the flood of news (true and fake) that Americans had to digest
Democrats are still looking for an excuse but clearly, you can't credit Trump's victory to Russia hacking the DNC's emails. Trump won the popular vote in 49 states by more than 1.5 million. He lost California by 4 million votes.

comments.commentBody:
Just another biased one sided article by the NYT! As always, look at what was left out.

The author is acknowledging that the Russian's were discussing whether to interfere but fails to disclose what they concluded. (You can be absolutely certain that the leaker would have shouted that they supported interference from the rooftop. If the Russians concluded they shouldn't, the leaker didn't tell the author or the author refused to print it! Where is the journalist's question on what the Russian's concluded and the leaker's answer?)

The author is acknowledging that the US listened to Russian conversations but has made no mention of the fact that Bill Clinton interfered in Russian elections which could have been Putins reason if he in fact authorized interference.

The author refuses to acknowledge that both the FBI and the CIA have stated that they have no direct proof of Russian interference or that they leaked emails to WikiLeaks.

The author refuses to acknowledge that WikiLeaks says they did not get the information from the Russians.

The author mentions protecting evidence of on this investigation but says nothing about protecting all evidence on all investigations including Hillary's emails.

What further evidence do you need of fake news and biased reporting?
Patriotic and well done. The Trump administration couldn't pull this off if it wanted to.
Thank you journalists. Thank you. Thank you. Thank you. Much respect.
Thank goodness for the Dutch! See... there is a reason we all spy on each other...
Again with unnamed sources and no evidence. Fake news

Was a very well practiced speech last night ,said little except some self exultations. But in the light of day ,the breadcrumbs of deception continue. If the administration tries to continue to bury the building facts,it will not have to drain the swamp,but it will be filled in with a mountain. The administration has filled its cabinet posts with many of them easily profiting from a recission of the trade embargo. Taxes please, on everyone. Let's stop muddying of waters.
Now THIS is journalism. Outstanding job guys.

There is a huge, huge problem of trust with the President. At least Hillary Clinton emails did not show her committing Treason with this country.  This new President clearly is a crook, liar and will do anything just to benefit himself. Shameful that there is a Political Party that is standing beside this man.  All Republicans that voted for Trump are guilty!!!! Instead of Throwing Hillary Clinton in Jail for Hiding Emails.. Throw Trump in front of a firing squad for Treason!!!
Listening to Brian Williams in his full glory tonight on MSNBC going on about this story, I can't even remember what he got in trouble for.
Weak and crooked. : /

Funny how the Obama administration had to scatter the various pieces of intelligence like horcruxes in order to save it from the real Lord Voldemort!

Hard-core Republican representative Darrell Issa said officially on Bill Maher's show last Friday that he would support the appointment of a special prosecutor to investigate Trump's connections to Russia. Could someone in Congress finally turn this into a motion?
